intro: Aphanactis boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in arid regions of Bolivia and adjacent countries.
